Description: Pottery lamp of the Frog Type. Top decorated with four bosses. Undefined base. Whitish-buff clay.
Curator's comments: Close: 'Kêmi' xxi, 1971, p.125, fig.34, 175, from Karnak; Bernhard 530, from Deir el-Medineh. Near: Mond, R., and Myers, O.H., 1934. ‘The Bucheum’, London : Egypt Exploration Society, pl. lxxxi, 4, 1-6: six examples from Baqaria Tomb 29, perhaps of the end of the third century AD.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2165)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
